description: Internal alterations to layout of two-storey building to form two self-contained flats; and associated amenity, cycle parking, vehicle parking and waste storage spaces.
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be retained in accordance with drawing title number(s): Location & Block Plan (ref. 100047474); Existing Site Plan As Approved (ref. 20-141LR-00P Rev A); Proposed Ground & First Floor Plan (ref. 20-141LR-05P Rev B); Proposed Loft & Roof Plan (ref. 20-141LR-06P Rev A); Proposed Front & Right-Side Elevation (ref. 20-141LR-07P Rev A); Proposed Rear & Left Side Elevation (ref. 20-141LR-08P Rev A);

Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building, and shall be consistent with those as listed within the submitted drawings / plans as listed in Condition 2.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the existing building and surrounding area in accordance with policies 7B and 7.4 of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan 2013, 1.1 and 1.2 of the Local Development Framework (Core Strategy 2012) and 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan (2016). | A minimum of two (2) 240 litre bins dedicated to recycling and two (2) 240 litre bins dedicated to refuse shall be provided as shown in the Approved Plans and in accordance with adopted standards of the local planning authority. Such provision shall be brought into use prior to first occupation and retained permanently..

Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area and in the interests of the future occupants of the development in accordance with policies with policies 3.5 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Plan 2013; 1.1 (e) of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy; and 5.16 of the London Plan (2015). | A minimum of four (4) cycle parking spaces shall be provided within covered and secured cycle storage facilities in accordance with adopted standards of the London Plan 2016. Such provision shall be brought into use prior to first occupation and retained permanently.
Reason: To provide adequate bicycle storage to align with Sustainable Transport SPG and Policy T5 of the London Plan (2021).
